page.title: 10Farming The Farmer's Day
page.content: On Friday l0th May l985 we went to interview the farmer. He told us about his working day. He said he got up at half past six and started work at half past seven. He works l4 hours most days. As he is an arable farmer his busiest times were during harvest when he often had to work late into the night to gather his crops. Even so there were jobs to be done on the farm all year round and these include ploughing, sowing, rolling and spraying. Sometimes he would have done more than one hour's work before breakfast. Part of his day has to be spent on book_keeping, something he does during the afternoon or evening. To help him keep his accounts and charts up_to_ date he uses a computer.
